1.text: And I saw upon the right hand of him sitting upon the throne, a book written within and behind, sealed with seven seals.

2.text: And I saw a strong angel proclaiming with a great voice, Who is worthy to open the book, and to loose its seals?

3.text: And none was able in heaven, nor upon earth, nor under the earth, to open the book, nor to look upon it.

4.text: And I wept much, that none was found worthy to open and to read the hook, neither to look upon it.

5.text: And one of the elders says to me, Weep not: behold, the Lion conquered, he being of the tribe of Judah, the Root of David, to open the book, and to loose its seven seals.

6.text: And I saw, and, behold, in the midst of the throne and of the four living creatures, and in the midst of the elders, a Lamb standing as having been slain, having seven horns and seven eyes, which are the seven Spirits of God sent into all the earth.

7.text: And he came and took the book from the right hand of him sitting upon the throne.

8.text: And when he took the book, the four living creatures and the twenty-four elders fell before the Lamb, having each harps, and golden bowls full of incenses, which are the prayers of the holy.

9.text: And they sing a new song, saying, Worthy art thou to take the book, and to open its seals: for thou wert slain, and didst purchase us to God by thy blood from every tribe, and tongue, and people, and nation;

10.text: And madest us kings and priests to our God: and we shall reign upon the earth.

11.text: And I saw, and heard the voice of many angels round about the throne and the living creatures and the elders: and their number was myriads of myriads, and thousands of thousands;

12.text: Saying with a great voice, Worthy is the Lamb slain to receive power, and riches, and wisdom, and strength, and honour, and glory, and praise.

13.text: And every creature which is in heaven, and in earth, and under the earth, and upon the sea, which are, and all things in them, heard I saying, To him sitting upon the throne, and to the Lamb, praise, and honour, and glory, and strength, for the times of times.

14.text: And the four living creatures said, Amen. And the twenty-four elders fell and worshipped him living for the times of times.
